questions.question_text:
The project is at the end of stage 1. The project manager is preparing the full business case using the PRINCE2 supporting techniques. The investment appraisal includes an assessment of the value of the underground parking space and potential income. This is based on the net present value of the anticipated income from the car park compared with the estimated cost of construction and offset by any associated risks. As the operating costs for the car park are not yet known, the decision has been taken not to include them.
Is this decision an appropriate application of the ‘business case’ practice, and why?

choices.A: Yes, because business justification should be based on the estimated cost of construction against the anticipated benefits offset by any associated risks
choices.D: No, because the anticipated income from the car park is uncertain and there is a risk that the benefits may not exceed the cost of construction
choices.C: No, because the investment appraisal should include the cost of maintaining the car park as well as the cost of its construction
choices.B: Yes, because the value of future benefits from car park income should be based on the current valve of money calculated using a discount rate

choices.D: No, because the Chief Technology Officer should be a team manager delivering the latest technology to the shopping centre
choices.A: Yes, because the project assurance role may be delegated to a technically competent person by the senior supplier if required
choices.C: No, because the senior supplier should delegate project assurance tasks to a technically competent person who can ensure the technical integrity of the IT solutions
choices.B: Yes, because the Chief Technology Officer has the knowledge and seniority to full a senior supplier role, ensuring the technical integrity of the IT solutions
